file_content.text: Look at you. Still nothing more than a common criminal hiding behind a blaster.
Until you embrace your full potential, you will only be a pawn of fate. Never its master.
Destiny isn't a personal choice. That's the whole point.
You grasp at understanding like a blind infant.
The future is not a river to carry us. It is the ocean in which we drown, if we are not prepared.
You have two destinies, Outlander. In one, you defeat Arcann, claim the Eternal Throne, and remake the galaxy.
In the other... you die alone, unmourned and forgotten. I brought you here to taste that defeat.
The Force is with you, Jedi, but it will not defeat my son. It never could.
You have survived many battles, but you are still merely a soldier.
You have mastered the dark side of the Force. It is not enough. It never was.
Your armor, weapons, and instincts are not enough to secure victory, hunter.
You think secrets grant power. That striking from the shadows will be enough. You are wrong.
I follow my own path, Valkorion. Not yours.
You truly believe that. How pathetic.
If you have all the answers, let's hear them. Start with why you let your son betray you.
Then show me how, old man.
Arcann saw what he wanted, and claimed it. What is your excuse for failing to do the same?
